data.title: Frequently Asked Questions – Skog Å Kust
data.meta_description: First, check the details in the product description again on skogakust.com to make sure it is supposed to have what you think it should. If you have any question we are here to solve it.
data.text:
General Order & Product Information

When will my order ship?

Our goal is to process and ship all orders within 48 hrs. Please note for orders placed after 2pm EST on a Friday will begin processing the following Monday morning.

Can I cancel or make changes to my order?

We process and ship all orders as quickly as possible. Please contact us as soon as possible if you need to modify or cancel your order. We are unable to cancel or modify orders once they have been processed for shipping.

What's your return policy?

Love S.Å.K or your money back! You have 30 days to return your item if it is in the original, unused condition. For details on initiating a return, head to our returns page.

What sort of warranty/guarantee do you offer on your products?

We warrant our products against any defects in materials and workmanship for the intended life of the product under normal use. For more information please visit our warranty page.

I have not received my order, what should I do?

The first step is to check your tracking information. You should have received an email from us as when your order shipped. That email will contain the relevant tracking information. If you didn’t receive that email, please contact us with your order information and we can help you track it down.

If the tracking shows as delivered, but you never got the package, you will have to pursue a claim with the carrier. We are not responsible for customer data entry errors regarding shipping or delivery instructions.

The product or variation I want is out of stock, when will it be available?

If a product is out of stock, you can enter your email address and be notified as soon as that product is back in stock. Simply enter your email address in the notification box after you select the product and size/color you would like to purchase. Once that product is available you will receive an email letting you know.

How do I place a bulk/wholesale order?

Please see our wholesale inquiries page or contact us for bulk pricing.

Do you offer customized products? Can get my organization’s logo printed on your products?

Yes! We would be happy to work with you to customize our products to fit your organization’s needs. Please contact us for more information about available options, minimum order quantities and pricing.

What’s with the name? What does it mean?

Skog Å Kust is Swedish for “forest, creek, coast” representing the range of natural environments for which our products are designed and intended.

Where is your company based, where are your products manufactured?

We are a small family owned and operated company based in Pennsylvania, USA. When you contact us you will get a response one of the members of our US based team. All of our orders ship from our US based warehouse. Our products are designed/tested in the USA, and manufactured in China.

Product Use & Care

Will the bag float?

Most of our products will float if they fall into the water. To help keep them buoyant, we recommend leaving some extra air in the bag when you seal it. Please note our roll-down style bags are not intended to be used under water, or as a life saving device, but are rated for brief shallow submersions (if they were dropped off of a boat or capsized kayak, for example).

What will each bag/size fit?

Please see our sizing information under the technical specifications. If you have questions about specific items fitting in a particular bag you can always contact us.

How do I clean my bags?

Cleaning our bags are very simple: you can remove most dirt simply with warm water and a non-detergent soap. It’s best to wash your them by hand. If they’re really dirty, you can hose them out first. Once you’ve hand washed your bags, leave them to air-dry. Make sure they’re completely dry before you store them as damp fabrics are subject to mildew.

If you are using your bags in desert/beach conditions, clean the teeth of your zippered pockets after use. Even though zippers are rust proof, if they are exposed to salt they should be washed with fresh water after use to avoid any salt build up. We recommend using zipper lubricant on all zippers before long term storage.

What sort of chemicals should I avoid contact with?

DEET from bug sprays will dissolve polyurethane, so be aware of this and keep them away from our PVC based bags.

Gasoline/mineral oil will also delaminate coatings and remove water-repellent finishes. Alcohol (the kind found in spray sunscreen and in iodine water treatments) is also bad, so avoid spraying these types of products directly on your bags.

The sun’s ultraviolet light can weaken the fabrics over time: the lighter the fabric, the more pronounced the effect. Keeping your gear out of the sunlight whenever possible will help it to last longer.
